actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 563.
Measure laid before Senate.
The committee substitute agreed to by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 97-1. Record Vote No: 113.
Received in the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Committee on Public Works + Transportation discharged.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.subcommittee: Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources.
Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs discharged.

actions.committee: Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Mr. Vento asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Public Works and Transportation be discharged from further consideration of the bill and that the bill be re-referred to the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Vento asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent.
On passage Passed without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-359.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water, Power and Offshore Energy Resources

official_title: A bill to redesignate the Calamus Dam and Reservoir authorized under the Reclamation Project Authorization Act of 1972 as the Virginia Smith Dam and Calamus Lake Recreation Area.

summary.text: Redesignates the Calamus Dam and Reservoir in the North Loup division of the Missouri River Basin project as the Virginia Smith Dam and Calamus Lake Recreation Area.

titles.title: A bill to redesignate the Calamus Dam and Reservoir authorized under the Reclamation Project Authorization Act of 1972 as the Virginia Smith Dam and Calamus Lake Recreation Area.
